alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:36AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Atoka County through 800 AM CDT... At 735 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Wardville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wardville, Chockie, and northeastern Atoka Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
